title: Duterte backs Lopez, but to review mine closures
text:
Duterte backs Lopez, but to review mine closures By Christina Mendez   
  President Duterte has thrown his full support anew behind Environment Secretary Gina Lopez, who is facing opposition at the Commission on Appointments (CA) and possible counter charges for being hard on mining firms in the country. 
Earning the ire of the mining industry, Lopez had ordered the closure of 25 mining firms for reportedly violating environmental laws and the cancellation of 75 contracts between the government and mining firms, known as mineral production sharing agreements, in watershed zones. 
Speaking before the Philippine Military Academy Dimasupil Class of 1967 at the Baguio Country Club last Friday, Duterte said he would still review the environment secretary’s decision which, he said, remains recommendatory. 
“Titingnan ko ‘yun, kung mali talaga, eh wala akong magawa (I will see, if it’s wrong, there’s nothing I can do),” Duterte said. “But I will review. There’s such thing as the exhaustion of administrative remedies. I will not judge her now.” 
Duterte’s statement came after the Chamber of Mines filed a complaint to oppose Lopez’s confirmation at the CA. 
The Palace earlier said the complaining parties should just file an appeal before the necessary agencies, including the Office of the President.
